results.title: The Last taboos
results.creator_credit: Cavalcade Productions, Ginger Blackwell and Dale McCulley
results.brief_description: Documentary dealing with the effects of childhood sexual abuse and is not intended as a study or demonstration of counselling techniques shown - the subject matter is emotionally charged and maybe disturbing. Group counselling American style, it encourages victims to talk about their experiences and to act out their anger, with good results.

results.title: The Last supper = La Ultima cena
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), Santiago Llapur, Camilo Vives and Tomas Gutierrez Alea
results.brief_description: This is a subtle, ironic fable, an allegory of the religious hypocrisy of a plantation owner towards his slaves, set in a time just after the Haitian revolution of 1795. The Cuban landowners are suddenly instilled with the fear of slave rebellion at the same time that the disruption of agriculture in Haiti offers them the chance to improve their position in the international market, but only on condition that they buy more slaves and intensify their exploitation, which only increases, of course, the dangers of rebellion. Trying to convince himself of his spiritual purity, a wealthy and guilt-ridden slave owner stages a Last Supper for 12 black slaves and himself as Christ. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Last stone = Posledny kamen
results.creator_credit: Slovenska Filmova Tvorba, Jaroslava Havettova and Julius Hucko
results.brief_description: A bitter animated joke about the frustration of being an artist in pay of the bureaucracy. A sculptor tries to impress officialdom with his most imaginative works, but does not make a hit - until the finale. The story is told with traditional animation, intercut with more experimental drawing to create geometric patterns. No narration, music and sound effects only.

results.title: The Last starfighter
results.creator_credit: Lorimar Film Entertainment, Universal Pictures, Gary Adelson, Edward Denault and Nick Castle
results.brief_description: A highly underrated science fiction produced in the wake of the Star Wars phenomenon, “The Last starfighter” is another supreme example of outer-space/fantasy that was the trend in Hollywood in the early 1980s. Lance Guest is Alex Rogan, who lives and works a dead-end job in his mother’s trailer park. His only escape: a video-game called “Starfighter”. When a mysterious stranger explains to him that “Starfighter” is more than just a game, Alex is thrust centrestage for a conflict that threatens not only Earth but the entire universe. With production design by Ron Cobb (of ‘Alien’ and ‘Star Wars’ fame) and a scorching soundtrack by Craig Safan, “The Last starfighter” is formulaic Hollywood at its most entertaining. Cast also includes Robert Preston, Dan O’Herlihy, Catherine Stewart and Barbara Bosson.

results.title: The Last stage = Ostatni etap [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Film Polski, Mieczyslaw Weiberger and Wanda Jakubowska
results.brief_description: Jakubowska, associated with progressive left-wing groups before the war, survived Auschwitz to collaborate with Schneider, a fellow prisoner, on this film based on German records, memoirs of fellow prisoners and their own memories. Death, inhuman suffering, fear and cowardice blends with the power of friendship, the will to survive, hatred of the torturers and love of fellow-sufferers. ‘At the expense of the story’s unity, it [is] a weave of strands, a number of these snapping in mid-pattern quite unexpectedly … rather as if someone were narrating in a voice choked with emotion…. No documentary could possibly equal this authenticity’. Reference: Boleslaw Michalek, Frank Turaj, The Modern Cinema of Poland, Indiana U.P., 1988, p. 5. Cast includes Wanda Bartowna, Alina Janowska, Zofia Mrozowska, Huguette Faget. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Last seduction
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment Group, Jonathan Shestack and John Dahl
results.brief_description: An updated film noir centering around Bridget Gregory, a beautiful, intelligent and ambitious femme fatal. After convincing her doctor husband to pull off a $700,000 cocaine deal, Bridget takes of with the money and hides out in a small town, where she meets Mike. She is tracked down by a private investigator hired by her husband. As the two start to close in on Bridget, she involves Mike in an elaborate scheme to keep the money and get rid of her husband. Cast includes: Linda Fiorentino, Peter Berg, Bill Pullman, J.T. Walsh and Bill Nunn. (Awards: New York)

results.title: The Last plane out of Berlin
results.creator_credit: Jeff Watson Productions, ABC-TV (Australia), Frank Haines and Jeff Watson
results.brief_description: This is a remarkable story about a remarkable Australian, Sidney Cotton, who was able to fool the German High Command to enable him to fly safely in and out of Germany as that country prepared for war. He took photographs that revolutionised aerial military photography forever. In fact his work in aerial espionage and photographic intelligence was to be instrumental in the foundation of the Photographic Reconnaissance Unit of the Royal Air Force. He worked on behalf of the French Deuxieme Bureau and the British MI6 and was a friend of Ian Fleming, creator of James Bond. Cotton was also a confidante of top ranking Nazis like Hermann Goering and Albert Kesselring and acted as a go-between in negotiations between Goering and the British Prime Minister, Neville Chamberlain. Born near Proserpine, Queensland, the son of a prominant Queensland grazier, Sidney Cotton, known for his continual defiance and love of adventure, was to be forever remembered as the one who flew the last civilian plane out of Berlin before the outbreak of World War II in 1939. He died in England in 1969 at the age of 74. Filmed as a docudrama with historical re-enactments and interviews with family, friends and former Air Force personnel. Also includes archival war footage, stills and home movies. Presented and narrated by Jeff Watson and filmed on location in Britain, Germany and Australia. Cast includes Geoffrey Morrell as Sidney Cotton and Jim Cullington as Field Marshall Kesselring.

results.title: The Last picture show
results.creator_credit: Columbia, BBS Productions, Stephen J. Friedman and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: Released in 1971 to critical acclaim and public controversy, this modern day classic directed by Peter Bogdanovich garnered eight Academy Award nominations (including Best Picture). It was hailed as “the most important work by a young director since Citizen Kane”. A frank, bittersweet drama of social and sexual mores in small-town Texas featuring a cast led by Timothy Bottoms, Jeff Bridges and Cybill Shepherd in her debut role. Cloris Leachman and Ben Johnson each won Oscars for their work in supporting roles. The characters created by Larry McMurty in his compelling novel are vividly brought to life in one of the most engaging coming-of-age stories ever filmed.

results.title: The Last of the Mohicans (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, Michael Mann and Hunt Lowry
results.brief_description: Daniel Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe star in this adaptation of James Fenimore Cooper’s classic tale of a white man raised by Mohicans and who becomes embroiled in a clash between two strong and rival nations. Set in the American colonies during the bitter Anglo-French war of 1757, Daniel Day-Lewis as Hawkeye brings strength and passion to the role. This film is typical of the epic romantic sagas with its fast action, breathtaking scenery, spectacular battle scenes and a superb cast.
